title: Happy to announce the upcoming launch of the book "Beat Reporting and Editing: Journalism in the Digital Age" edited meticulously by Prof. Dr. Surbhi Dahiya and Shambhu D. Sahu of the Indian Institute of Mass Communication -my alma mater. Vice President Venkaiah Naidu has written the foreword for the book being published by SAGE and should be out in the next few weeks. I have contributed a chapter in the book on International Affairs Reporting drawing from my experiences in various newsrooms spanning across 18 years. It was a learning experience for me too and I am thankful for the opportunity. The whole idea is to provide students of journalism with a practical and resourceful tool kit to understand the multi layers of reporting and specialization on niche areas and specific beats as they brace up for the real world of news. The editors have put together a team of seasoned journalists from diverse backgrounds. Please do help spread the word and look out for the launch event soon!

title: Should 12th #BoardExams2021 be cancelled? I spoke to multiple stakeholders- parents, educationists and students from different boards on #PeoplesEditor last evening. I personally think it is high time to do so. Children have gone through a harrowing time amid this pandemic. Physical exams will put millions of students and their families to further risk. And online exams can hardly ensure fairness given the digital and economic divides in our society. One year of no exams should not make hell of a difference to the long journey ahead for young students who need to stop being subjected to the emotional and mental stress because of constant postponement of exams. Let there be alternate systems‚Ä¶ More

title:
Hi everyone. How are you doing? How is your family holding up?
Apologies that I have not found time to update posts on this page for the past few days. Have been inundated with SOS calls for help on social media for beds, ventilators, Oxygen supplies, #Covid drugs and more. It is a harrowing exhausting experience for all of us who have literally gone sleepless now.

Many of us -political activists and young leaders across political lines, social activists, bureaucrats, ordinary citizens with extra ordinary grit, journalists- are trying to do whatever we can to amplify these voices of need and help support people in individual capacities. Sometimes we succeed, many times we do not. It is a‚Ä¶

title:
My intervention last night on the Mirror Now debate following Prime Minister Modi‚Äôs scathing words about the failures of United Nations Today. Most of the criticisms are justified. But I disagreed with my fellow panelist and noted strategic expert Mahroof Raza who argued that India should give an ultimatum and walk out of he UN if urgent reforms do not take place.
The world definitely needs to imagine alternate structures which are more representative of changed realities and reformed, but now is not the time to throw the baby with the bath water. Built on the ruins of the Second World War, UN needs to introspect and course correct to get past and existential crisis staring at it. But in the absence of alternate mechanisms it still serves several useful purposes. Let us also not forget that India‚Äôs share of the UN budget is only 0.7 percent (China-8, Japan-10 and US-22%). You would need the economy to get back on track to dig deeper into your pockets and lead world bodies in addition to the several key contributions India is credited with.

title:
Some quick thoughts on #FreedomOfPress on #IndependenceDay.

A #FreePress is a must for any Democracy that claims to be vibrant. Journalists have been killed, physically beaten up, legally intimidated, rendered jobless and harassed in various ways by state and non-state actors across the globe. India slipped 20 ranks in the world press freedom index in 2020 to the 142nd position. (Conflict torn Afghanistan is at 122nd - https://rsf.org/en/ranking_table )

Governments want you to believe that the press as an institution is entirely delegitimised today and there is no need for a Prime Minister to hold a press conference or for those in positions of power to be held accountable and answer‚Ä¶

title:
Saddened to hear about the untimely demise of Mrs.Joyce Anderson, Principal of Assembly of God Church School , Asansol. Mrs. Anderson started leading my alma mater some years after I passed out from it.

But I had an opportunity to meet Mrs.Anderson when she very kindly invited me to address the senior students few years ago. She came across as a very warm person who was open to new ideas and experiments which is crucial for nurturing young minds into thinkers of tomorrow.

My deepest condolence to her family and loved ones. My thoughts with the teachers, students and staff of AG Asansol. May everyone find the needed strength in this hour. Sharing a photo from the time when I met her, she is to my left. Let us all remember her warmth today as we mourn her loss. Assembly Of God Church School, Asansol.

title:
#Covid19 is real threat.It is taking lives.It is destroying families. Please be individually and collectively responsible. #WearAMask , maintain social distancing, step out of your homes only when really needed, practice safe hygiene and sanitation practices, Ayurveda can help boost immunity but there is no cure for #CoronaVirus in Ayurveda or Homeopathy so please do not fall for fake news or quack doctors. A vaccine is yet to be discovered.
Also do not stigmatise Covid 19 patients and those who have recovered should definitely try and donate plasma.Count your blessings if you have a roof above your head, food on your platter, healthy family and a job that pays. Millions of people today are without jobs and look at an uncertain future because of the virus. So please stop treating it like some joke. Be responsible, be safe. Remind yourselves and everyone around you about it every day.

My comments on #IndoNepal ties and challenges at the webinar organised yesterday (Counter- 1.09.00 and 2.00.00) .

While it is highly disturbing that a 2 percent of unresolved border should blow up into major row to cast deep shadows over historic relations, and India should have found the time to hold atleast a virtual dialogue showing some urgency on the matter. But at this stage following the constitutional amendment that PM Oli has gone through with playing the nationalism card, PM #Modi will not be coerced to the Dialogue table any time soon now. For now New Delhi will remain focussed on the #LAC situation and a stalemate will continue in ties with Kathmandu. Jingoism and rhetoric can help with domestic point scoring but can never be effective Foriegn policy tools.
One can only hope that the technical cooperation and development projects continue with consistency to help tide over this rough patch in relations. For now Delhi will wait to see how things play out internally for #Nepal PM amid an ongoing power struggle.

title:
‚ÄúI refuse to accept the cynical notion that nation after nation must spiral down a militaristic stairway into the hell of thermonuclear destruction. I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word in reality. This is why right temporarily defeated is stronger than evil triumphant. I believe that even amid today‚Äôs mortar bursts and whining bullets, there is still hope for a brighter tomorrow. I believe that wounded justice, lying prostrate on the blood-flowing streets of our nations, can be lifted from this dust of shame to reign supreme among the children of men. I have the audacity to believe that peoples everywhere can have three meals a day for their bodies, education and culture for their minds, and dignity, equality and freedom for their spirits. I believe that what self-centered men have torn down men other-centered can build up.‚Äù

Words that need to resonate now more than ever. Nobel Peace Prize acceptance speech of Martin Luther King. #Archives

TV channels Alone Do Not define the entire news industry.There are 100s of honest journalists beyond the handful of starry anchors and editors you love or hate. If you are stuck with shouting screaming bigoted channels then a lot of the problem also lies with you the viewer.

title: Posting late in the day. My sister Shweta Sharma is one of the most passionate teachers I have known (and I hardly ever praise specially in public). She gave me a wonderful opportunity to interact with the students of grades 6 to 8 in Vivekanand Government Middle School in Deoghar last December. The students who have their own elected PM, Cabinet and hold them accountable, gave me a very warm and attentive welcome. These girls and boys belong to the poorest and most deprived sections of society. They have no one to guide them at home, most of them initially signed up for school maybe hoping for a free meal. It is an everyday struggle importantly for the girls to fight taboos in the‚Ä¶ More

title: Was good returning to Jindal Global University for the #IndiaImmersion program lecture. Nearly 40 Australian students from 9 top universities under the New Colombo Plan are spending three weeks in India as part of a residential course. Spoke to them about defining moments in Indian foreign policy history in past decades, the Modi era and key regional security challenges. Also moderated a conversation with Retired Ambassador Amit Dasgupta on Leadership & Diplomacy in the 24/7 online era.
